definition: A two-dimensional grid characterized by rows and columns
A single record in a table
A set of data values of a defined type in a table
A unique identifier for a record in a table
A field in one table that uniquely identifies a row of another table
A way to structure data using tables.
A mathematical theory that deals with collections of objects
Store user defined data
Store metadata - data about the database
An organized collection of data consisting of multiple tables
A table whose primary key is referenced by a child table
A table that contains data related to a specific entity in a relational database, often linked to a parent table through a foreign key.
A property that ensures relationships between tables remain consistent
A table used to connect two or more tables in a Many to Many relationship
A visual representation of the entities in a database and their relationships.
A single column in a database table that is used to uniquely identify a row.
A combination of two or more columns in a database table that can uniquely identify a row in that table.
A relationship where a single record in one table is associated with a single record in another table.
A relationship where a single record in one table can be associated with multiple records in another table.
A relationship where multiple records in one table can be associated with multiple records in another table.
